reviews.sentence: Hotel review. Location was good. 15 miles south of la jola town center and a block or two away from the ocean where the surf is good. The hotel is very clean mattress and box springs both bagged. They clean the carpets on a regular basis. All furniture was reasonably clean. The staff were all very nice and helpful. The breakfast is mostly pastry toast and some fruit apples and oranges. They have a heated pool which is comfortable to swim in and a jacuzi. A reasonable place to stay for such an expensive area.

TOTALLY amazing stay location location location. Our recent stay at the La Jola Travel Lodge was far beyond our expections. The staff were extremely helpful and we really enjoyed the efficiency kitchen in our room. The LOCATION was amazing. close to the beach great restaurants local transit runs right outside the door. Really enjoyed the continental breakfast pool and hot tub. What can I say this hotel has it all. Had a chance to meet the manager and was really empresed with his thoughtfulness and detail pertaining to his clients. Front desk staff could not of been more helpful and friendly. Thanks so much for our stay we will certainly be back in Sept.

Great location it is a smaller older hotel but it is kept up well for its age. Pool was heated and the hot tub was nice just a few minute walk to the Lajola beach and a short ride to seal rocks. We had an enjoyable and pleasant stay.

Exceptional. Loved this locationeasy walk to beach and the hot tub and pool were very nicethe employees were all so helpful with directions and friendlythe su casa so close has great food and the little lunch and breakfast place ca nt remember name but was good and manderine house was good as weli went with a girl friend i hadbt seen in a long time to have some girl funenjoyed it so much i m going back in 5 weeks.

A wonderful place to return to. We look forward to come back to this well kept hotel every winter. The manager Daniel Nesbit has created a family hotel of very good quality with a very nice staff. The location is perfect close to Windansea beach. The rooms are clean and well equipped. The pool is warm and clean. The breakfast is very good. This year we returned with our son and his family. Our grandchild seems to like the hotel too. So we all hope to come back soon.

Close to the beach only two blocks. Rooms were clean and good size except for the few rooms that were under the stairs and dark. But we asked for another room and were immediately accommodated. Beds were comfortable staff was friendly adequate pool and spa. Breakfast was just right and there was unlimited tea coffee bottled water and fruit all day. Bus stop on the corner takes you to downtown SD and Pacific beach if you want to avoid parking hustle close enough to La Jola Cove on foot about 30 min slow walk but very short drive there and to La Jola Shores. The local beach was only two blocks away short and pleasant walk. It was a bit rocky but heaven for surfers but there were patches of sandy areas where the water was calm and swimable. Few near by places to eat close to the hotel but better restaurants were in the La Jola cove area with healthier choices and better views. Lights above bed were centered over the head board and were a bit low banged my head few times while sitting in bed.
FUN AND GOOD VALUE. GREAT STAFF GREAT LOCATION GOOD VALUESMAL BATHROOM THAT NEEDS UPDATING POOL AREA NEEDS A GOOD CLEANING.

Excellent value. Excellent value for La Jola. Staff all very friendly and helpful. Pool and hot tub good. Out of the centre of La Jola but a short drive and you can walk in about 30 minutes. Breakfast was nice good bagels. but no breakfast room at the moment so had to be taken to room.
Nice staff great location hot tub and heated pool.

Two night stay. The Travelodge is located close to the beach in the La Jola neighbourhood nice for going to swim or a run in the morning. Some restaurants and a small supermarket 7Eleven are located close by. The rather busy street quiets down at night. The personal was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Compared to a typical US motel breakfast the breakfast was quite rich. At the moment there is some renovation going on. Parking space is somewhat limited and there may be some noise during the day. But it did not feel disturbed by it and I always appreciate improvements being made to the rooms. Right now the interior starts looking dated but that should be gone soon.

We had a newly updated room very nice. The facility is currently undergoing renovations but it did not impact our stay other than the pool area was closed for a few of our days. A short walk to the beach with gorgeous sunsets.

Great value for money in the San Diego area. Clean and modern basic hotel room old refurbished motel. Beds are very comfortable. And the balcony is nice to have. Very nice and helpful staff. Let us use the showers by the pool after having checked out that day. Good location in La Jola. No decent door between bed and bathroom the rooms are a little dark with just on front window.

Everything was broken totally understaffed get locked in and out of the pool constantly and have to yell for the staff to let you out no butter at the breakfast counter. Poor service over all. Only nice thing was that you could rent bikes for 10 an hour per person.
Very pleasant stay. Loved being so close to the beach. Very close to the beautiful beach. Surrounding area great for walking. Pool needs some work and water was too warm.
Close to the beach and walking to La Jola shops. Motel style but very large rooms and small pool available.

Modern chic place near the beach. Staff were lovely. Rooms were modern and clean. Love the flooring. Not a carpet in sight. Grubby carpets are my pet hateThe front rooms were close to the road if you are a light sleeper. Pool area not the best. Not inviting to use.
Love be there small place to eat next door. Great food. Small hotel quiet. Bathroom need towel rack and hooks to hang towels and swim wear. The pool needs some help.
Love be there small place to eat next door. Great food. Small hotel quiet. Bathroom need towel rack and hooks to hang towels and swim wear. The pool needs some help.

Wonderful. The Shoal is situated very near the beach which is an added bonus and close to getting downtown or the Torey Pine Cliffs. The place itself is oddly situated but so are many homes in La Jola. We were always able to find parking onsite but not necessarily in front of our room. We enjoyed swimming in the pool as the weather was quite hot in Sept However the pool area is small and not very appealing but the water is clean. The coffee was great but I thought there had be a continental breakfast. You could make oatmeal if you wanted though. There was not closet in the room but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was clean. Compared to other places priced really high The Shoal suited us for the three nights just fine.

A Great CA Beach Getaway. What a great location. We walked everywhere along the beach to shopping and to lunch and dinner. The decor in the room was amazing love the teal doors and the black white theme in the bathroom and the comfy bed was like sleeping on a cloud. We did not want to leave and come home to our own bed. Since we only stayed one night we did not have time to enjoy the pool area but it looked clean and very inviting. As many other travelers have mentioned in their reviews the staff here is over the top friendly and helpful which is just the icing on the cake. Tricia checked us in and out and we absolutely loved her sparkling personality. The young gentleman my husband interacted with at the front desk in the evening was great as well. we will definitely stay here again if we are in the area and we highly recommend The Shoal Hotel La Jola BeachWe were pleased with everything.
